isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR - COMBUSTION LEAKAGE TEST

step1.para: Inspect the radiator cap gasket and the radiator filler neck seat for damage to insure that air leakage will not occur.
Check the overflow pipe for damage.
Fill the radiator to the top of the filler neck which is beyond the normal fill capacity.
With the engine at operating temperature, operating at low idle speed, thermostat fully opened and the cooling system purged of air, fill the test bucket and pop bottle with water.

figure.caption: Figure 2.1 Combustion Leakage Test and Connections

step1.para: Immerse the filled pop bottle in the bucket of water with the filler neck facing the bottom of the bucket as shown in Figure 2.1.
Insert the overflow line extension into the bottle neck.
Observe the pop bottle for aeration (bubbles) or, in extreme cases, the water in the pop bottle will be blown out.

note.para: Bubbles or expulsion of water from bottle indicate head gasket leakage or a cracked or porous cylinder head.
